appendix.title: Tasks
appendix.para: Description of WASP tasks. WASP Tasks are semaphores between the web application, human interaction (HI) steps, and the batch processor.

tasksummary.para: This is the only State that is explicitly created by the web application. This Task indicates to the batch system that a job has been correctly submitted and is ready for processing.

procedure.step: Create a State with a Task of type "Start Job" and a status of TaskStatus.CREATED. Start Job States do not have a parent State.
The batch processor polls for states of this type and will execute the back-end processing based on collected metadata.

tasksummary.para: Created to indicate the progress of sending of the initial quote for a Job request.

procedure.step: Create a State with a Task of type "Quote Job" and a status of TaskStatus.CREATED.
When the quote has been confirmed as sent, the web/business layer changes the status to TaskStatus.COMPLETED.
The batch processor will advance the state to TaskStatus.FINALIZED and proceed with flow processing.
